rComments: He's very rigorous and pedantic. It's the analytical style of philosophy. I found him a great help in learning how to think and argue philosophically. He's very gracious and nice outside of class, and a very fair marker.

This man is a walking ego. Prompts students to participate in dialogue and engage, but only to condescend them immediately and validate himself. If you want to get a full thought out be prepared to push it past his inevitable interruptions, and if it is a worthy thought, he will deflect away as you "missed the point". No respect for his students.
Kofman is a genius, but can be really tough if you are not prepared. Good on textbooks, as he will either pick a cheap one, or post all online.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', 'So many papers']

rComments: I enjoyed his lectures and his midterms/exams are fairly easy. Follow what he wants and you'll receive a good mark. Also most readings are online so you won't need to spend your money. One of the best profs I've had in awhile..looking forward to having him again next year!
He's a great professor. He is very knowledgeable, and a real philosopher. He also manages to be entertaining while clarifying serious issues. I would take any course with this prof.

He is so boring and one of the worst teachers I've had at Uottawa. Sweet man but terrible prof. He stands at the front of the class and reads from a random textbook, goes off on stories that have nothing to do with the class. Really hard to focus because he is just so boring. I don't recommend taking this class with him

His lectures are interesting if you actually listen and he relays the information effectively. I found that people hated him or protested their marks a lot, but you could guess the questions he would ask on the midterms and exam. I found it easy if you studied possible questions. Fair prof.

This professor is awesome. You learn more from one of his lectures than in some entire courses. He is also really approachable and generous with his time, and is great with questions inside and outside of class. He'll go over every syllable of your essays with you if you ask. It's a real privilege being in this professor's class.
As people say, he is nice, but his expectations in this course are extremely high and he is zero help with suffering marks
Take one of his classes if you want to learn how to be a better thinker while you're at uottawa...top notch professor.

Kofman is not an easy prof (40+ readings for this course and 3 textbooks!) but he is wonderful. A charming, funny, and brilliant man who does his best to teach 2500 years of pol. philosophy in a 12 week course. The difficulty of the course is due to the massive content, and he grades exams very reasonably.
The best philosophy prof I've had at UOttawa!

Kofman's explanations of the basics are crystal clear and easy to grasp. However, he then builds on this quickly, showing complications, historical background, implications. His knowledge and intelligence are pretty impressive. He stimulates you to think more about the issues. Maybe some weak students just want easy notes. Great prof, and funny.

I've had Kofman twice. He really knows his stuff. But he is not an easy prof. His classes are very interesting but could be hard to follow, With that being said, he is extremely helpful. Go see him after class, he will make the time to clear anything up.
This prof is funny and nice but very biased. It is impossible to take notes in his class because he goes off on a lot of tangents and he never tells us what is really important to know.

Having passed one of Kofman's epistemology classes should be added to the list of sufficient conditions for knowledge. If you did the readings, you would know that his lectures are perfectly clear, coherent and informative. By the contrapositive of the above conditional, I infer that those who think otherwise did not do the readings! Good prof
Interesting course, insightful lectures. I learned a lot.
I enjoyed this professor's lectures immensely, and decided to minor in philosophy as a direct result. I will try to take any course he teaches.

He's a good professor for those who take philosophy or mathematics as a major.  For those of us with a sincere but not all encompassing interest in philosophy he is not entirely accommodating.  He is often vague, not completely covering material and often digresses into things that only somewhat pertain to the course material. Phil. minors beware.
Best professor I've had in my 4 years at OttawaU! If you take his class, you will learn a lot.
The only reason why this class is hard is because he chooses to make it hard. If you don't have to take a class with him, then don't.
First time I ever saw a class applaud at the end. I learned more than in most other classes combined.

I highly recommend taking this class! If you want to get anything out of your education, you should take a class with Kofman. His class will make you progress in your thinking, writing and reading of philosophical texts. Kofman is just a great prof. and also approachable..he really will talk to you for hours in his office if the topic interests you
I recommend taking any class taught by Professor Kofman! Great class.
Terrific course, best I've taken. Lectures clear and engaging, made me think constantly. But definitely not easy.
Completely and utterly incoherant. If the information is up there in his head it is certainly not being filtered down to us, his mere students.
His lectures are always interesting and stimulating. I recommend taking any class he is teaching!
I love Kofman!
Awesome prof! Very interesting.
great prof. Take his class!
Very insightful and thought-provoking lectures if you are interested in philosophy.
Best Prof!
I love Professor Kofman.
I took three courses with Kofman, he was my favourite professor. His critiques of different philosophies were awesome.

Fascinating course, very insightful. Kofman teaches it on a high level, which I appreciated. He was also very helpful in explaining how to write philosophical essays. He's really generous with his time outside of class. Great teacher.

Brilliant and funny, vast knowledge and amazingly kind - I learned a ton. One of the most interesting professors in the department. Will talk to you for hours in his office if you're really interested in the topic.
Knows the subject matter like the back of his hand, and if he's not familiar with a text, he probably knows the guy who wrote it.

Beware!  He is the most BORING teacher ever.  Talks about the same thing over and over, horrible teacher, like he didn't even know what CPR was...common now.  IF you can avoid having him as a teacher, do it!!

His teaching has improved since the 2006 year, but he can still be a little incomprehensible sometimes.  Still, he was more interesting in PHI1102 than other PHI courses he's taught, and he was pretty clear on what he expected from the class.  It's the greasy first years that don't have a clue, not Kofman.  Not a fantastic prof, but not a bad one.
Kofman tries to keep it interesting, but in doing so he is offensive and I am forever scarred with the image of 100 000 boiling babies. He also has different sized sideburns.
Avoid! Danger! Warning! Danger!
Interesting professor, very insightful. Made the material  as interesting as possible.

Koffman energetic and can lecture for three hours off the top of his head. He'll help you out if you ask and is really nice. Anything he doesn't know he'll look up for you. He tells you exactly what will be on the tests and prepares you well.  He's no Rusnock or Forster but he tries hard and is good enough.

Worst Prof ever! This guy is extremely boring and a jerk to boot. He's not helpful outside class times and suffers from sever little man syndrom. Avoid this teacher at all costs, he'll drop an A student down to failure.
